title: Admin creates a new user account with a primary role
description: As an Admin, I want to create a new user account by providing their name, email, and assigning a primary role, so that I can securely grant a new employee the appropriate level of system access to perform their job duties.
business_value: Enables secure and controlled onboarding of new employees by provisioning role-based access to the system, ensuring users have the correct permissions from their first login.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful creation of a new user with a primary role","given":"I am logged in as an Admin and am on the 'Create User' screen","when":"I enter a unique, valid email address, the user's full name, and select a 'Primary Role' (e.g., 'Dispatch Manager') from the available options","then":"The system creates the new user account, the user appears in the list of system users, and the user is automatically assigned to the security group corresponding to the 'Dispatch Manager' role."},{"scenario":"Attempt to create a user with a non-unique email address","given":"I am logged in as an Admin and am on the 'Create User' screen","when":"I enter an email address that already exists for another user in the system and attempt to save","then":"The system prevents the creation of the user and displays a clear, user-friendly error message such as 'A user with this email address already exists.'"},{"scenario":"Attempt to create a user with missing required information","given":"I am logged in as an Admin and am on the 'Create User' screen","when":"I attempt to save the new user without providing a name, email, or selecting a primary role","then":"The system prevents the record from being saved and visually indicates which mandatory fields are missing."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Code for extending `res.users` with role management logic is reviewed and merged.","Unit tests for the role assignment logic in `create`/`write` methods are passing with >80% coverage.","Security rules restricting this functionality to Admins are verified.","Feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Admin defines and assigns a primary role to a user
description: As an Admin, I want to assign a single, predefined primary role (like Dispatch Manager, Finance Officer, or Driver) to a user account, so that I can efficiently manage access control and ensure each user has the appropriate permissions to perform their job duties according to the principle of least privilege.
business_value: Enforces a secure and manageable Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) system. Simplifies user onboarding and role changes, reduces the risk of unauthorized access, and ensures compliance with the principle of least privilege.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Assign a primary role to a user","given":"I am logged in as an Admin and am viewing the user management form for an existing user.","when":"I select a primary role, for example 'Dispatch Manager', from the 'Primary Role' dropdown and save the user's record.","then":"The system successfully saves the change, assigns the 'Dispatch Manager' role to the user, and their permissions are immediately updated to reflect that role's access rights."},{"scenario":"Admin attempts to change their own role to a non-Admin role","given":"I am logged in as an Admin and am editing my own user profile.","when":"I attempt to change my 'Primary Role' from 'Admin' to 'Driver' and save the record.","then":"The system must prevent the change and display a clear validation error message, such as 'Administrators cannot revoke their own admin privileges.'"}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Code for managing security group memberships based on role selection is reviewed and merged.","Unit tests for role-switching logic and admin self-demotion prevention are passing.","E2E testing confirms a user's permissions change correctly after their role is modified.","Feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Admin creates a new vehicle record
description: As an Admin, I want to create a new vehicle record by entering its key details like truck number, model, capacity, and ownership status, so that the vehicle is officially registered in the system and can be managed, assigned to trips, and tracked for operational and financial purposes.
business_value: Establishes the foundational master data for the vehicle fleet, enabling core functionalities like trip assignment, expense tracking, and operational reporting. This is critical for the system's primary purpose.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful creation of a new vehicle record with all mandatory fields","given":"I am logged in as an Admin and am on the 'Vehicles' list view","when":"I click the 'Create' button, fill in all mandatory fields (Truck Number, Model, Capacity, Owner Details, Fuel Type) with valid and unique data, and click 'Save'","then":"A new vehicle record is successfully created in the system, its status defaults to 'Active', and I am redirected to the new vehicle's form view."},{"scenario":"Attempt to create a vehicle with a duplicate Truck Number","given":"A vehicle with the Truck Number 'KA01AB1234' already exists in the system","when":"I attempt to create a new vehicle and enter 'KA01AB1234' in the Truck Number field and click 'Save'","then":"The system prevents the record from being saved and displays a clear, user-friendly error message stating that the 'Truck Number must be unique'."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Code for the `tms.vehicle` model and associated views is reviewed and merged.","Unit tests for model constraints (uniqueness, format) are passing with >80% coverage.","Security access rules are verified to restrict access to Admins.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Admin attaches a document with an expiry date to a vehicle record
description: As an Admin, I want to upload vehicle-specific documents (like Insurance, RC, Fitness Certificate), categorize them, and set their expiry dates, so that I can maintain a centralized, digital record of all compliance documents and enable the system to generate timely renewal alerts, ensuring our fleet remains legally operational at all times.
business_value: Ensures legal and regulatory compliance by tracking critical vehicle documents, preventing fines and operational downtime from expired certifications. Centralizes documentation for easy access and auditing.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successfully upload a new, valid document to a vehicle","given":"I am an Admin logged into the system and am viewing the form for an existing vehicle","when":"I navigate to the 'Documents' section and click 'Add Document', then I select a 'Document Type', choose a future 'Expiry Date', upload a valid file (PDF, JPG, PNG under 5MB), and click 'Save'","then":"The document is successfully uploaded and associated with the vehicle record, and the new document appears in the list of documents for that vehicle."},{"scenario":"Attempt to upload a file with an unsupported format or size","given":"I am an Admin on the 'Add Document' form","when":"I attempt to upload a file that is larger than 5MB or has an unsupported file type (e.g., .zip, .exe)","then":"The system rejects the file and displays a user-friendly error message specifying the allowed file types and size."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Code for the `tms.vehicle.document` model and view modifications is reviewed and merged.","Integration testing confirms that files are correctly stored in and retrieved from the S3 bucket.","Security testing confirms file access is restricted to authorized users.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Admin creates a new driver record by extending an HR employee
description: As an Admin, I want to create a new driver record by adding driver-specific details (like license information) to an existing HR employee record, so that I can properly onboard drivers into the Transport Management System, ensure compliance, and make them available for trip assignments.
business_value: Enables the creation of a compliant and operational driver pool, which is fundamental for trip assignment and management.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successfully designate an existing HR employee as a driver with all required information","given":"I am logged in as an Admin and am on the form view of an 'hr.employee' record that is not yet designated as a driver","when":"I enable a flag 'Is a Driver', enter a valid 'License Number' and a future 'License Expiry Date', and save the record","then":"The system saves the employee record successfully, and this employee now appears in the list of available drivers for trip assignments."},{"scenario":"Driver-specific fields are hidden for non-driver employees","given":"I am logged in as an Admin and am viewing the form of an 'hr.employee' record","when":"The 'Is a Driver' flag is not enabled","then":"The fields for 'License Number' and 'License Expiry Date' are not visible on the form."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Code for extending the `hr.employee` model and view is reviewed and merged.","Integration testing confirms the new driver is available for trip assignment.","Security rules restricting edit access to Admins are verified.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Admin creates a new customer record with GSTIN validation
description: As an Admin, I want to create a new customer record by entering their essential business details, including name, billing address, GSTIN, and contact information, so that the new customer is available in the system for trip planning, accurate invoicing, and maintaining a centralized client database.
business_value: Enables new business by onboarding clients into the system. Ensures data accuracy for logistics and financial operations.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful creation of a new customer with valid data","given":"The Admin is logged into the system and has navigated to the Customer management screen","when":"The Admin clicks 'Create', fills in all mandatory fields (Customer Name, Billing Address, GSTIN) with valid data, and clicks 'Save'","then":"The system successfully creates a new customer record, and the Admin is viewing the form of the newly created customer."},{"scenario":"Attempt to save a new customer with an invalid GSTIN format","given":"The Admin is on the new customer creation form","when":"The Admin enters a GSTIN that does not match the standard Indian format and attempts to save","then":"The system prevents the record from being saved and displays a clear error message next to the GSTIN field."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Code for extending the `res.partner` model and view is reviewed and merged.","Unit tests for GSTIN validation logic are passing with >80% coverage.","Security rules restricting edit access to Admins are verified.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Admin creates and manages pre-defined transportation routes
description: As an Admin, I want to create and manage a master list of pre-defined transportation routes, including a name, source, destination, and standard distance, so that Dispatch Managers can quickly select a standard route during trip creation, ensuring consistency and speeding up the planning process.
business_value: Improves operational efficiency by reducing manual data entry for trip creation. Enhances data accuracy and consistency by standardizing common routes.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Admin successfully creates a new pre-defined route","given":"The user is logged in as an 'Admin' and has navigated to the 'Routes' management screen","when":"The user initiates the creation of a new route and fills in all mandatory fields ('Route Name', 'Source', 'Destination', 'Standard Distance') with valid data","then":"The system saves the new route record to the database and it appears in the list of pre-defined routes."},{"scenario":"System prevents route creation with missing mandatory information","given":"The user is on the new route creation form","when":"The user attempts to save the route without providing a 'Route Name'","then":"The system prevents the record from being saved and displays a clear validation message."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Code for the `tms.route` model and views is reviewed and merged.","Unit tests for model constraints are passing.","Security access rules are verified to restrict access to Admins.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Admin manages the list of material types
description: As an Admin, I want to create, view, edit, and deactivate material types, so that I can ensure data consistency across the system and provide a predefined list for trip creation.
business_value: Ensures data integrity for accurate reporting and improves efficiency in the trip creation process by providing a predefined list of materials.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Admin creates a new material type successfully","given":"The user is logged in as an Admin and is on the 'Material Types' list view","when":"The user clicks 'New', enters a unique name (e.g., 'Industrial Solvents'), and clicks 'Save'","then":"The system creates a new, active material type record, and it appears in the list view."},{"scenario":"System prevents creation of a material type with a duplicate name","given":"A material type with the name 'Cement Bags' already exists","when":"The Admin attempts to create a new material type and enters 'Cement Bags' as the name","then":"The system prevents saving the record and displays a user-friendly validation error message."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Code for the `tms.material` model and views is reviewed and merged.","Unit tests for model constraints (uniqueness) are passing.","Security access rules are verified.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Dispatch Manager creates a new trip
description: As a Dispatch Manager, I want to create a new trip record by selecting a customer, defining the route, and specifying the material details and rate, so that I can formally initiate a transport job and move it into the planning and assignment phase.
business_value: Initiates the primary revenue-generating workflow of the system. Enables formal planning, resource allocation, tracking, and subsequent invoicing for a transport job.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful trip creation with all valid manual inputs","given":"I am logged in as a Dispatch Manager and am on the 'New Trip' form","when":"I select an 'Active' customer, enter Source/Destination, select a Material, enter Weight, select a Rate Type, enter a Rate value, and select a future Expected Delivery Date","then":"The system successfully creates a new trip record with a unique ID and sets its initial status to 'Planned'."},{"scenario":"Attempt to save a trip with missing mandatory fields","given":"I am on the 'New Trip' form","when":"I attempt to save the form without selecting a Customer (or Source, or Destination)","then":"The system prevents the record from being saved and displays a clear validation message."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Code for the `tms.trip` model, state machine, and views is reviewed and merged.","Unit tests for all business rules and validations are passing with >80% coverage.","E2E test for the happy path of trip creation is passing.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Dispatch Manager assigns an available vehicle and driver to a trip
description: As a Dispatch Manager, I want to select an available vehicle and an available driver from filtered lists and assign them to a 'Planned' trip so that I can operationalize the trip and move it to the 'Assigned' status.
business_value: Enables the transition of a trip from planning to execution, ensures efficient and compliant resource allocation, and prevents operational errors.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful assignment of a valid vehicle and driver","given":"I am a Dispatch Manager viewing a trip in 'Planned' status","when":"I select an 'Active' vehicle with sufficient capacity and an 'Active' driver with a valid license, and save the assignment","then":"The system successfully links the vehicle and driver to the trip, and the trip's status changes from 'Planned' to 'Assigned'."},{"scenario":"Attempt to assign a vehicle with insufficient capacity","given":"I am a Dispatch Manager viewing a trip with a material weight of 25 Tons","when":"I attempt to select and assign a vehicle with a capacity of only 20 Tons","then":"The system must prevent the assignment and display a clear error message."},{"scenario":"Attempt to assign a driver with an expired license","given":"I am a Dispatch Manager viewing a trip","when":"I attempt to select a driver whose license is expired","then":"The system must prevent the assignment and display a clear error message."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Server-side validation for license expiry and vehicle capacity is implemented and tested.","Unit tests for the assignment validation logic are passing.","The trip status correctly transitions to 'Assigned' upon successful assignment.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Dispatch Manager cancels a trip
description: As a Dispatch Manager, I want to cancel a trip at any stage before delivery and provide a mandatory reason, so that the system accurately reflects the trip's status, releases assigned resources, and provides a clear audit trail.
business_value: Ensures data integrity, improves resource utilization by releasing vehicles and drivers, and provides data for operational analysis by capturing cancellation reasons.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Cancel an assigned trip with a valid reason","given":"A Dispatch Manager is viewing a trip with the status 'Assigned'","when":"The user clicks 'Cancel Trip', enters a reason, and confirms","then":"The trip's status is updated to 'Canceled', the reason is saved, and a notification is sent to the assigned driver."},{"scenario":"Attempt to cancel a trip without providing a reason","given":"A Dispatch Manager has initiated the 'Cancel Trip' action","when":"The user attempts to confirm without entering a reason","then":"The system prevents the cancellation and displays a validation error."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","The trip cancellation wizard is implemented and functional.","The notification to the driver is correctly triggered.","The action is restricted to authorized roles.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Driver logs into the mobile-friendly web portal
description: As a Driver, I want to securely log into a simple, mobile-friendly web portal using my credentials, so that I can access my assigned trips, submit expenses, and update my status while on the go.
business_value: Enables drivers to access the system, which is the primary entry point for all field-based data capture, enabling real-time operational visibility.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful login with valid credentials","given":"A user with the 'Driver' role exists and is on the mobile-friendly login page","when":"The driver enters their correct username and password and taps 'Log In'","then":"The system validates the credentials, establishes a secure session, and redirects the driver to their main portal dashboard."},{"scenario":"Login page responsiveness on mobile device","given":"A user is accessing the login page","when":"The page is viewed on a device with a screen width of 360px","then":"All UI elements are clearly visible and usable without horizontal scrolling."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","The custom OWL-based login page is implemented and reviewed.","The login page is confirmed to be fully responsive on target mobile devices.","E2E tests for the driver login flow are passing.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Driver views their list of current and past trips
description: As a Driver, I want to view a clear, mobile-friendly list of my current and past trips, so that I can easily see my immediate assignments and review my work history.
business_value: Improves operational efficiency by providing drivers with immediate access to their assignments, reducing communication overhead with dispatch.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Default view shows current trips","given":"a Driver is logged into the mobile web portal","when":"the driver navigates to the 'My Trips' page","then":"a list of their 'Current' trips is displayed by default, containing only trips with 'Assigned' or 'In-Transit' status."},{"scenario":"Data is properly scoped to the logged-in driver","given":"a Driver is logged in","when":"they access the 'My Trips' page","then":"the system must ensure that only trips explicitly assigned to that driver are displayed."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","The 'My Trips' OWL component is implemented and reviewed.","Backend controller correctly filters trips based on the logged-in driver.","UI is confirmed to be responsive on mobile devices.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Driver starts a trip from the mobile portal
description: As a Driver, I want to be able to mark a trip as 'In-Transit' when I begin my journey, so that the dispatch team is immediately aware that the delivery has started.
business_value: Provides real-time operational visibility to dispatchers, enables accurate transit time tracking, and triggers live GPS monitoring.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Driver successfully starts an assigned trip","given":"I am a Driver logged into the mobile portal viewing a trip with status 'Assigned'","when":"I tap the 'Start Trip' button and confirm","then":"The system updates the trip's status to 'In-Transit' and the 'Start Trip' button is hidden."},{"scenario":"Action is unavailable for trips not in 'Assigned' status","given":"I am a Driver viewing a trip","when":"The trip's status is anything other than 'Assigned'","then":"The 'Start Trip' button must not be visible or must be disabled."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","The 'Start Trip' action is implemented in the Trip Detail OWL component.","Backend controller correctly updates the trip status and enforces authorization.","E2E test for starting a trip is passing.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Driver uploads a Proof of Delivery (POD)
description: As a Driver, I want to upload a Proof of Delivery (either a photo or a captured e-signature), so that I can formally confirm the delivery is complete, which updates the trip status to 'Delivered' and initiates the billing process.
business_value: Provides auditable proof of service completion, a prerequisite for customer invoicing, and provides real-time operational visibility to the back-office team.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Driver successfully uploads a POD photo","given":"a Driver is viewing an 'In-Transit' trip","when":"the Driver selects 'Upload POD', chooses 'Photo', selects an image, enters the recipient's name, and submits","then":"the system uploads the photo, records the details, changes the trip status to 'Delivered', and displays a success message."},{"scenario":"Driver successfully captures an e-signature POD","given":"a Driver is viewing an 'In-Transit' trip","when":"the Driver selects 'Upload POD', chooses 'E-Signature', captures a signature, enters the recipient's name, and submits","then":"the system saves the signature as an image, records the details, changes the trip status to 'Delivered', and displays a success message."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","The POD upload OWL component, including signature capture, is implemented and reviewed.","Backend controller handles file uploads to S3 and updates the trip status atomically.","E2E tests for both photo and signature upload are passing.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Driver submits a trip-related expense with receipt
description: As a Driver, I want to submit a trip-related expense through my mobile web portal by selecting the expense type, entering the amount, and uploading a photo of the receipt, so that I can get reimbursed and the company can accurately track trip costs.
business_value: Enables accurate and timely tracking of trip-related expenditures, which is crucial for calculating trip profitability and managing driver reimbursements.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful submission of a standard expense (e.g., Toll)","given":"I am a logged-in Driver viewing an 'In-Transit' trip","when":"I navigate to 'Add Expense', select 'Toll', enter an amount, upload a valid receipt, and press 'Submit'","then":"The system creates a new expense record linked to my trip with a status of 'Submitted' and displays a confirmation message."},{"scenario":"Attempt to submit with missing required fields","given":"I am on the 'Add Expense' form","when":"I leave the 'Amount' field blank and press 'Submit'","then":"The system prevents submission and displays an inline validation error."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","The `tms.expense` model and expense submission OWL component are implemented and reviewed.","Backend controller handles validation and file uploads to S3.","Unit tests for validation logic are passing.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: System Enforces Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) for All Data Models
description: As a System Administrator, I want the system to strictly enforce data access and modification rights based on a user's assigned role, so that sensitive company data is protected, operational integrity is maintained, and each user can only perform actions relevant to their job function.
business_value: Ensures data security and confidentiality, enforces the principle of least privilege, prevents unauthorized actions, and reduces the risk of user error.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Dispatch Manager has operational access","given":"A user is logged in with the 'Dispatch Manager' role","when":"The user accesses the system","then":"The user has full CRUD permissions on Trip and Expense records, but has read-only access to Customer, Vehicle, and Driver records, and is restricted from financial and admin functions."},{"scenario":"Finance Officer has financial access","given":"A user is logged in with the 'Finance Officer' role","when":"The user accesses the system","then":"The user has full CRUD permissions on Invoices and Payments, can view trips and expenses, but is restricted from operational functions like creating trips."},{"scenario":"Driver has restricted, personal access (Record-Level Security)","given":"A user is logged in with the 'Driver' role","when":"The user navigates to the list of Trips","then":"The user can ONLY see Trip records where they are the assigned driver."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Security groups, ACLs (`ir.model.access.csv`), and record rules (`ir.rule`) are implemented and reviewed.","Automated integration tests verify key access restrictions (e.g., driver record rule).","Manual testing cycle completed for each user role.","The feature is deployed and verified in the staging environment."]

title: Admin executes a one-time data migration from the legacy system
description: As an Admin, I want to execute a well-defined process with supporting scripts to migrate key master data and open financial transactions from our legacy system into the new TMS, so that the system is populated with essential business data at go-live.
business_value: Enables business continuity by populating the new TMS with critical operational data before go-live, avoiding data loss and manual re-entry.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful migration of active customer master data","given":"A clean CSV file containing active customers from the legacy system is available","when":"The Admin executes the customer migration process","then":"All customer records from the file are created in the Odoo 'res.partner' model, and the post-migration validation report shows matching record counts."},{"scenario":"Migration script handles records with missing mandatory data","given":"A source CSV file where a record is missing a mandatory field","when":"The Admin executes the relevant migration script","then":"The script skips the invalid record, logs a detailed error, and successfully processes all other valid records."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing in the staging environment.","Migration scripts and supporting documentation are reviewed and merged.","Unit tests for key data transformation logic are passing.","A full E2E migration dry-run has been successfully completed in staging.","The validation report from the dry-run is reviewed and approved by stakeholders."]

title: Admin validates migrated data in a staging environment
description: As an Admin, I want to execute a dry-run of the data migration in a staging environment and receive a comprehensive validation report, so that I can verify data integrity and fix issues before the production cutover.
business_value: Mitigates the significant business risk of data loss or corruption during go-live. Ensures business continuity by verifying all critical data is accurately transferred.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Validation report shows matching record counts for master data","given":"The migration dry-run has been successfully executed","when":"The Admin reviews the generated validation report","then":"The report shows identical counts for 'active Customers', 'all Vehicles', and 'active Drivers' between the source and target."},{"scenario":"Validation report shows successful financial reconciliation","given":"The migration dry-run has been successfully executed","when":"The Admin reviews the validation report","then":"The report confirms the sum of all open invoice balances from the source matches the sum of all outstanding balances in the staging TMS."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Migration validation scripts are reviewed and merged.","Unit tests for the validation logic are implemented and passing.","A successful dry-run has been demonstrated to stakeholders using the full legacy dataset.","The Admin user has formally signed off on the process and its results."]

title: SRE provisions cloud infrastructure as code
description: As an SRE/Admin, I want the entire application infrastructure to be defined as code, so that I can deploy, modify, and replicate the environment in an automated, reliable, and version-controlled manner.
business_value: Reduces manual deployment errors, increases deployment speed and reliability, and enables disaster recovery by allowing for rapid, automated environment recreation.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Provisioning the entire AWS environment","given":"I have the Terraform scripts and appropriate AWS credentials","when":"I run `terraform apply`","then":"All required AWS resources, including the VPC, EKS cluster, RDS instance, S3 bucket, ElastiCache, and Amazon MQ, are successfully provisioned and configured."},{"scenario":"Verifying connectivity between resources","given":"The infrastructure has been provisioned","when":"A test application is deployed to the EKS cluster","then":"The application can successfully connect to the RDS database, Redis cache, and RabbitMQ broker."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Terraform code is reviewed, modularized, and merged.","The Terraform state is managed remotely (e.g., in an S3 bucket).","A full `terraform apply` and `terraform destroy` cycle completes successfully in a non-production environment.","The provisioned infrastructure is verified to meet security and high-availability requirements."]

title: Developer gets fast feedback via an automated CI pipeline
description: As a Developer, I want a Continuous Integration (CI) pipeline to automatically run tests and quality checks on every pull request, so that I can get fast feedback on my changes, prevent regressions, and maintain high code quality.
business_value: Improves code quality, reduces bugs in production, and increases development velocity by automating the code review and validation process.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"CI pipeline passes for a valid pull request","given":"I open a pull request with code that adheres to linting standards and has passing tests with sufficient coverage","when":"The CI workflow is triggered","then":"All jobs in the workflow (linting, testing) complete successfully, and a green checkmark appears on the pull request."},{"scenario":"CI pipeline fails for a pull request with failing tests","given":"I open a pull request that contains a failing unit test","when":"The CI workflow is triggered","then":"The 'tests' job fails, the overall workflow is marked as failed, and a red cross appears on the pull request."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","The GitHub Actions workflow file for PR validation is reviewed and merged.","The pipeline correctly runs linters and the Pytest suite for both the Odoo addon and the FastAPI service.","The pipeline correctly enforces the 80% test coverage requirement.","The workflow is a required status check for merging pull requests."]

title: SRE/Admin deploys the application via an automated CD pipeline
description: As an SRE/Admin, I want a Continuous Deployment (CD) pipeline to automatically build container images and deploy the application to the staging environment after every merge, so that I can release new features reliably and with minimal manual intervention.
business_value: Accelerates the release cycle, reduces the risk of manual deployment errors, and ensures a consistent and repeatable deployment process.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful deployment to staging after a merge","given":"The CI pipeline for a pull request has passed","when":"The pull request is merged into the `main` branch","then":"The CD workflow is triggered, new Docker images are built and pushed to ECR, and the staging EKS cluster is updated with the new application versions."},{"scenario":"Verifying the new version is live","given":"The CD workflow has completed successfully","when":"I access the staging application URL","then":"I am interacting with the newly deployed version of the application."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","The GitHub Actions workflow file for staging deployment is reviewed and merged.","The pipeline correctly authenticates with AWS, builds and pushes images to ECR, and applies Kubernetes manifests.","A successful merge to `main` results in a fully automated deployment to the staging environment.","The deployment process is documented in a runbook."]
